meanings.definition: A narrow piece of land that projects from a coastline into the sea.
meanings.sent1: The headland jutted out into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: We walked along the headland to get a better view of the waves.
meanings.sent3: The headland looked like a giant finger pointing towards the water.
meanings.sent4: The headland stood like a brave sentinel guarding the shore.
meanings.sent5: The headland was a natural bridge between land and sea.

meanings.definition: The highest point of a hill or mountain.
meanings.sent1: From the headland, we could see the entire valley below.
meanings.sent2: The headland offered a breathtaking panoramic view of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The headland felt like the king of all the surrounding hills.
meanings.sent4: The headland rose majestically above the rest of the terrain.
meanings.sent5: The headland was a majestic throne overlooking the land.
